intro: Oreogrammitis miltiblepharis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wall-rush, is a member of the family Hypnaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. It typically grows on shaded, moist rocky or soil surfaces, often in forested or mountainous regions. The plant features small, lanceolate leaves that are usually pale green to whitish in color. It produces minute, greenish to brownish spores in capsules that are clustered in dense groups. Oreogrammitis miltiblepharis is a cryptogamic plant, meaning it reproduces through spores rather than seeds.
